title: D in Dynamo logo
content:
Looking for a script in the style of the D in the Dynamo, Minsk logo, particularly with a similar broken-script sharp transition in the vertical stroke. Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701053346im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Dynamo_4272.jpg)

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Dynamo.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701053346/http:/typophile.com/files/Dynamo.jpg) | 54.39 KB |
author: donshottype

comments.content:
Except for the broken-script sharp transition in the vertical stroke -- which is what I am hoping exists somewhere as a font or lettering -- the base letter looks similar to Inserat Cursive, as shown in Nick Curtis's Graphic Stylin NF [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/graphic-stylin-nf/](http://web.archive.org/web/20140701053346/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/graphic-stylin-nf/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/nicksfonts/graphic-stylin-nf/")  
Any ideas?  
Don
Sorry, Don. That D looks rather clunky to me and I don't remember seeing one like it before.

Hi Mike, thanks for your reply. I know it's a hand lettered logo -- perhaps from 1927? -- but I thought it worth plumbing the depths of knowledge of our resident font detectives. Never know what surprises could uncovered unless I ask.  
Don
